policies.dataprotectionpolicy:
1. Introduction

IQBike is committed to safeguarding the privacy and personal information of our users, customers, and employees. This Data Protection Policy outlines our practices concerning the collection, processing, storage, and sharing of personal data.

2. Definitions

- "Personal Data": Any information relating to an identified or identifiable individual.
- "Data Subject": The individual to whom the Personal Data relates.
- "Processing": Any operation performed on Personal Data (e.g., collection, storage, use, disclosure, etc.).
- "Data Controller": IQBike, the entity that determines the purposes and means of Processing Personal Data.
- "Data Processor": We engage XYZ Data Services as a Data Processor to Process Personal Data on behalf of IQBike.

3. Data Collection

We may collect Personal Data directly from Data Subjects or through third parties for specified, explicit, and legitimate purposes. The types of Personal Data we collect may include, but are not limited to:

- Name
- Contact Information (email, phone number, address)
- Date of Birth
- Identification Information (e.g., government-issued ID)
- Payment Information (if applicable)
- Website Usage Data (e.g., IP address, cookies, etc.)

4. Data Use and Purpose

We will Process Personal Data solely for specific and lawful purposes, including but not limited to:

- Providing bike rental services and processing rental orders
- Managing and maintaining customer accounts and subscriptions
- Sending marketing communications (with consent, where applicable)
- Conducting internal research and analysis to improve our services
- Complying with legal obligations related to data retention and reporting

5. Data Security

We take appropriate technical and organizational measures to protect Personal Data from unauthorized access, alteration, disclosure, or destruction. Access to Personal Data is restricted to authorized personnel and third parties who require access to fulfill their duties.

6. Data Sharing

We may share Personal Data with third-party service providers, partners, or affiliates to support our bike rental operations and customer service. Data sharing is subject to data protection agreements or other appropriate safeguards to ensure confidentiality and security.

7. Data Retention

We will retain Personal Data only for as long as necessary to fulfill the purposes for which it was collected or as required by applicable laws. Once the data is no longer necessary, we will securely dispose of it.

8. Data Subject Rights

Data Subjects have certain rights concerning their Personal Data, including:

- Right to access and obtain a copy of Personal Data
- Right to rectify inaccurate or incomplete Personal Data
- Right to withdraw consent (where applicable)
- Right to erasure (right to be forgotten) under certain circumstances
- Right to restrict Processing under certain circumstances
- Right to data portability (where applicable)
- Right to object to Processing under certain circumstances

9. Children's Privacy

Our bike rental services are not intended for children under the age of 16. We do not knowingly collect or Process Personal Data from children without parental consent. If we discover that Personal Data of a child has been inadvertently collected, we will take immediate steps to delete it.

10. Changes to this Policy

We may update this Data Protection Policy from time to time to reflect changes in our practices or legal requirements. The most recent version will be available on our website.

11. Contact Information

If you have any questions, concerns, or requests related to this Data Protection Policy or your Personal Data, please contact us at privacy@iqbike.com or call us at +1 (555) 123-4567.

IQBike
Date: August 5, 2023
policies.legalnotice:
1. Introduction

Welcome to our website. This legal notice governs your use of our website; by using our website, you accept this notice in full. If you disagree with any part of this notice, you must not use our website.

2. Intellectual Property Rights

Unless otherwise stated, we or our licensors own the intellectual property rights in the website and material on the website. Subject to the license below, all these intellectual property rights are reserved.

3. License to Use Website

You may view, download for caching purposes only, and print pages or other content from the website for your own personal use, subject to the restrictions set out below and elsewhere in this notice.

4. Limitations of Liability

The information on this website is provided free-of-charge, and you acknowledge that it would be unreasonable to hold us liable in respect of this website and the information on this website. While we endeavor to ensure that the information on this website is correct, we do not warrant its completeness or accuracy.

5. Privacy Policy

We are committed to safeguarding the privacy of our website visitors; our privacy policy sets out how we will treat your personal information.

6. Variation

We may revise this notice from time-to-time. Please check this page regularly to ensure you are familiar with the current version.

7. Entire Agreement

This notice constitutes the entire agreement between you and us in relation to your use of our website and supersedes all previous agreements in respect of your use of our website.

8. Law and Jurisdiction

This notice will be governed by and construed in accordance with the laws of Slovenia, and any disputes relating to this notice shall be subject to the exclusive jurisdiction of the courts of Slovenia.
